MusicCache¶

Note

This module gets not used in MusicDB. It may get removed in future.

This class manages the music cache. This cache is used for the following features of MusicDB:

  1. Streaming: Instead of on-the-fly transcoding, MusicDB uses this cache.
  2. Export: This cache can be used as a clean base for exporting music to other devices. (The mobile app will use this cache as source)
  3. HTML5-Source: The WebUI can use this cache as clean source to access the music via HTML5-Audio-Tags.

Features and Constraints¶

  • Audio files are 320kbps mp3 files
    • They have clean and valid Unicode ID3v2.3 tags
    • They have artworks with a resolution of 500x500 pixels
  • File names have the following scheme: ArtistID/AlbumID/SongID:Checksum.mp3
  • All files in the cache are managed by MusicDB and should not be accessed by any user or other software

Configuration¶

Most features of the cache are strict and cannot be configured. Only the place where the cached files will be stored can be defined in the musicdb.ini file:

; Example of the mp3 cache configuration
[music]
cache=/opt/musicdb/data/mp3cache

Updating the Cache¶

For updating the cache, call the MusicDB Commandline Module cache.

musicdb cache update

Examples

Add a song to the cache¶

This example adds a new song to the cache using the MusicCache.Add() method.

database = MusicDatabase("./music.db")
config   = MusicDBConfig("./musicdb.ini")
cache    = MusicCache(config, database)

# Add song
song   = database.GetSongById(1000)
retval = cache.Add(song)
if retval == False:
    print("Adding %s failed! - See log file for details."%(song["name"]))

Get a songs path inside the case¶

This example gets the path to a cached song using the MusicCache.GetSongPath() method.

database = MusicDatabase("./music.db")
config   = MusicDBConfig("./musicdb.ini")
cache    = MusicCache(config, database)

# Get song
song = database.GetSongById(1000)
path = cache.GetSongPath(song)
if not path:
    print("Song %s not cached!"%(song["name"]))

MusicCache Class¶

class mdbapi.musiccache.MusicCache(config, database)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • config – MusicDB configuration object
  • database – MusicDB database
Raises:

TypeError – when config or database not of type MusicDBConfig or MusicDatabase
Add(mdbsong)[source]¶

This method checks if the song exists in the cache. When it doesn’t, the file will be created (this may take some time!!).

This process is done in the following steps:

  1. Check if song already cached. If it does, the method returns with True
  2. Create directory tree if it does not exist. (ArtistID/AlbumID/)
  3. Convert song to mp3 (320kbp/s) and write it into the cache.
  4. Update ID3 tags. (ID3v2.3.0, 500x500 pixel artworks)
Parameters:mdbsong – Dictionary representing a song entry form the Music Database
Returns:True on success, otherwise False
GetAllCachedFiles()[source]¶

This method returns three lists of paths of all files inside the cache. The tree lists are the following:

  1. All artist directories
  2. All album paths
  3. All song paths
Returns:(Artist-Paths, Album-Paths, Song-Paths)
Return type:A tuple of three lists

Example

(artists, albums, songs) = cache.GetAllCachedFiles()

print("Albums in cache:")
for path in albums:
    name = musicdb.GetAlbumByPath(path)["name"]
    print(" * " + name)

print("Files in cache:")
for path in songs:
    print(" * " + path)
GetSongPath(mdbsong, absolute=False)[source]¶

This method returns a path following the naming scheme for cached songs (ArtistID/AlbumID/SongID:Checksum.mp3). It is not guaranteed that the file actually exists.

Parameters:
  • mdbsong – Dictionary representing a song entry form the Music Database
  • absolute – Optional argument that can be set to True to get an absolute path, not relative to the cache directory.
Returns:

A (possible) path to the cached song (relative to the cache directory, absolute got not set to True). None when there is no checksum available. The checksum is part of the file name.
RemoveOldAlbums(calbumpaths, mdbalbums)[source]¶

This method compares the available album paths from the cache with the entries from the Music Database. If there are albums that do not match the database entries, then the cached album will be removed.

Parameters:
  • calbumpaths (list) – a list of album directories in the cache (scheme: “ArtistID/AlbumID”)
  • mdbalbums (list) – A list of album rows from the Music Database
Returns:

Nothing
RemoveOldArtists(cartistpaths, mdbartists)[source]¶

This method removes all cached artists when they are not included in the artist list from the database.

cartistpaths must be a list of artist directories with the artist ID as directory name. From these paths, a list of available artist ids is made and compared to the artist ids from the list of artists returned by the database (stored in mdbartists)

Is there a path/ID in cartistpaths that is not in the mdbartists list, the directory gets removed. The pseudo code can look like this:

for path in cartistpaths:
    if int(path) not in [mdbartists["id"]]:
        self.fs.RemoveDirectory(path)
Parameters:
  • cartistpaths (list) – a list of artist directories in the cache
  • mdbartists (list) – A list of artist rows from the Music Database
Returns:

Nothing
RemoveOldSongs(csongpaths, mdbsongs)[source]¶

This method compares the available song paths from the cache with the entries from the Music Database. If there are songs that do not match the database entries, then the cached song will be removed.

Parameters:
  • csongpaths (list) – a list of song files in the cache (scheme: “ArtistID/AlbumID/SongID:Checksum.mp3”)
  • mdbsongs (list) – A list of song rows from the Music Database
Returns:

Nothing
